# Reducing Digital Distraction
Welcome to the accompanying website for the **Re**ducing **D**igital **D**istraction (ReDD) workshop.

Here, you can find further details about the tools and strategies listed on the cards handed out in the workshop.

Read more on the pages [Block/Remove](https://ulyngs.github.io/reducing-digital-distraction/block.html), [Track yourself](https://ulyngs.github.io/reducing-digital-distraction/track.html), [Advance goals](https://ulyngs.github.io/reducing-digital-distraction/goals.html), [Reward/punish](https://ulyngs.github.io/reducing-digital-distraction/reward.html), and [Environment](https://ulyngs.github.io/reducing-digital-distraction/environment.html).

Most of the browser extensions and apps listed here come from our paper [Self-Control in Cyberspace](https://dl.acm.org/citation.cfm?doid=3290605.3300361). 
In this paper, we reviewed a large number of digital self-control tools from the Google Play, Chrome Web, and Apple App stores.
You can scroll through the full list of tools we reviewed here: [tinyurl.com/digital-selfcontrol](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1BVBCBOZQY_K7qYmDiSIail07F6D1iDG1OkoFyazb5Y4/edit#gid=777024457).
